sen.j: 佐伯 全成（さえき の またなり、? - 天平勝宝9歳（757年））は、奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: SAEKI no Matanari (date of birth unknown - 757) was a noble in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Matanari (date of birth unknown - 757) was a noble in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Matanari (date of birth unknown - 757) was a noble in the Nara Period.

sen.j: 本姓は「佐伯宿禰」。
sen.e: His main name was "SAEKI SUKUNE."
His main name was "SAEKI SUKUNE."
His main name was "SAEKI SUKUNE."

sen.j: 陸奥守兼鎮守副将軍。
sen.e: He was a Mutsu no Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Vice-Shogun for the Defense.
He was a Mutsu no Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Vice-Shogun for the Defense.
He was a Mutsu no Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Vice-Shogun for the Defense.

sen.j: 従五位上。
sen.e: He was a Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was a Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was a Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 天平15年（743年）、橘奈良麻呂から皇太子に黄文王を据えるよう謀反を唆されるが全成は拒絶。
sen.e: In 743, TACHIBANA no Naramaro urged Matanari to raise a rebellion by installing Prince Kibumi as the Crown Prince.
In 743, TACHIBANA no Naramaro urged Matanari to raise a rebellion by installing Prince Kibumi as the Crown Prince.
In 743, TACHIBANA no Naramaro urged Matanari to raise a rebellion by installing Prince Kibumi as the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 天平18年（746年）、従五位下。
sen.e: In 746, he became a Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 746, he became a Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 746, he became a Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: この時期全成は陸奥国介として蝦夷征討や陸奥国の政務についていたものと考えられている。
sen.e: During this perido, Matanari is believed to have engaged in the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in the Eastern Japan and the political affairs of Mutsu Province as Mutsu no Kuni no Suke (the assistant governor of Mutsu Province).

During this period, Matanari is believed to have engaged in the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in the Eastern Japan and the political affairs of Mutsu Province as Mutsu no Kuni no Suke (the assistant governor of Mutsu Province).

During this period, Matanari is believed to have engaged in the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in the Eastern Japan and the political affairs of Mutsu Province as Mutsu no Kuni no Suke (the assistant governor of Mutsu Province).

sen.j: 天平21年（749年）、当時金の産出がなされていなかった日本において陸奥守百済王敬福が黄金を発見し黄金900両を聖武天皇に献上した。
sen.e: In 749, Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI, who was Mutsuno Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) then, found gold in Japan, where gold had never been found until then, and presented it (900 ryo) to Emperor Shomu.

In 749, Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI, who was Mutsuno Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) then, found gold in Japan, where gold had never been found until then, and presented it (900 ryo) to Emperor Shomu.

In 749, Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI, who was Mutsuno Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) then, found gold in Japan, where gold had never been found until then, and presented it (900 ryo) to Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 東大寺の造営に多量の金を必要としていた聖武天皇はこれに狂喜し元号を天平から天平感宝に改め、同年5月11日、元陸奥国介であった全成も正五位上に昇進した。
sen.e: Since he was in need for a huge amount of gold for building Todai-ji Temple, Emperor Shomu became frenzied with joy about this gold, so he changed the era from Tenpyo into Tenpyo Kanpo, and on May 11 in the same year, Matanari, the former Mutsu no Kuni no Suke, was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

Since he was in need for a huge amount of gold for building Todai-ji Temple, Emperor Shomu became frenzied with joy about this gold, so he changed the era from Tenpyo into Tenpyo Kanpo, and on May 11 in the same year, Matanari, the former Mutsu no Kuni no Suke, was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

Since he was in need for a huge amount of gold for building Todai-ji Temple, Emperor Shomu became frenzied with joy about this gold, so he changed the era from Tenpyo into Tenpyo Kanpo, and on May 11 in the same year, Matanari, the former Mutsu no Kuni no Suke, was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: さらに天平勝宝4年（752年）5月26日、百済王敬福が常陸守に任ぜられるとその後任として陸奥守に任ぜられた。
sen.e: Further, on May 26, 752, when Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI was appointed to be Hitachi no Kami (the governor of Hitachi Province), Matanari was appointed to become Mutsu no Kami in order to take over his place.

Further, on May 26, 752, when Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI was appointed to be Hitachi no Kami (the governor of Hitachi Province), Matanari was appointed to become Mutsu no Kami in order to take over his place.

Further, on May 26, 752, when Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI was appointed to be Hitachi no Kami (the governor of Hitachi Province), Matanari was appointed to become Mutsu no Kami in order to take over his place.

sen.j: また全成は4月9日の東大寺廬舎那大仏開眼供養において久米舞舞頭を務めている。
sen.e: Matanari also was the head of Kumemai dance at the service for the consecration of the Rushana Great Buddha of Todai-ji on April 9.
Matanari also was the head of Kumemai dance at the service for the consecration of the Rushana Great Buddha of Todai-ji on April 9.
Matanari also was the head of Kumemai dance at the service for the consecration of the Rushana Great Buddha of Todai-ji on April 9.

sen.j: 聖武天皇が譲位し孝謙天皇が即位した天平勝宝（749年）11月、全成は再び奈良麻呂から謀反の計画を謀られていた。
sen.e: In November, 749, when Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne and Empress Koken acceeded, Matanari was again approached by Naramaro to take part in a rebellion.
In November, 749, when Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne and Empress Koken acceeded, Matanari was again approached by Naramaro to take part in a rebellion.
In November, 749, when Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne and Empress Koken acceeded, Matanari was again approached by Naramaro to take part in a rebellion.

sen.j: しかしこのときも全成は謀反への協力を拒絶した。
sen.e: However, Matanari refused to be part of the rebellion again.
However, Matanari refused to be part of the rebellion again.
However, Matanari refused to be part of the rebellion again.

sen.j: 天平勝宝8歳（756年）4月、聖武太上天皇不予の際黄金を納めるため陸奥より上京した全成は奈良麻呂から三度目の謀反計画を謀られた。
sen.e: In april, 756, when Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) was sick, Matanari took gold to Kyoto from Mutsu, he was approched by Naramaro to be part of the rebellion for the third time.
In april, 756, when Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) was sick, Matanari took gold to Kyoto from Mutsu, he was approched by Naramaro to be part of the rebellion for the third time.
In april, 756, when Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) was sick, Matanari took gold to Kyoto from Mutsu, he was approched by Naramaro to be part of the rebellion for the third time.

sen.j: 大伴古麻呂とともに佐伯・大伴両氏族を率いて黄文王を擁立し仲麻呂派を除こうというものであったが、両者はこれを拒絶した。
sen.e: The rebellion plan was to back up Prince Kibumi by leading both the SAEKI and OTOMO clans with OTOMO no Komaro in order to purge the group of Nakamaro, but both of them rejected it.
The rebellion plan was to back up Prince Kibumi by leading both the SAEKI and OTOMO clans with OTOMO no Komaro in order to purge the group of Nakamaro, but both of them rejected it.
The rebellion plan was to back up Prince Kibumi by leading both the SAEKI and OTOMO clans with OTOMO no Komaro in order to purge the group of Nakamaro, but both of them rejected it.

sen.j: 同年6月4日、聖武太上天皇が崩御すると孝謙天皇の皇太子には遺言により道祖王が立太子された。
sen.e: On June 4, 756, with the demise of Shomu Daijo Tenno, Funado no Okimi was installed as the Crown Prince of Empress Koken according to the will.
On June 4, 756, with the demise of Shomu Daijo Tenno, Funado no Okimi was installed as the Crown Prince of Empress Koken according to the will.
On June 4, 756, with the demise of Shomu Daijo Tenno, Funado no Okimi was installed as the Crown Prince of Empress Koken according to the will.

sen.j: しかし，翌天平宝字元年（757年）3月、道祖王が孝謙天皇の不興を受けたため廃太子となると、5月に仲麻呂が推す大炊王が立太子された。
sen.e: However, in March, 757, when Funado no Okimi was deposed because Empress Koken was displeased with him, Oi no Okimi, backed up by Nakamaro, was installed as the Crown Prince in May.
However, in March, 757, when Funado no Okimi was deposed because Empress Koken was displeased with him, Oi no Okimi, backed up by Nakamaro, was installed as the Crown Prince in May.
However, in March, 757, when Funado no Okimi was deposed because Empress Koken was displeased with him, Oi no Okimi, backed up by Nakamaro, was installed as the Crown Prince in May.

sen.j: この一件により奈良麻呂派と藤原仲麻呂派の対立は抜き差しならぬものとなった。
sen.e: This incident made the conrontation between the group of Naramaro and the group of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro even more severe.
This incident made the confrontation between the group of Naramaro and the group of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro even more severe.
This incident made the confrontation between the group of Naramaro and the group of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro even more severe.

sen.j: 対立の原因は孝謙天皇の母光明皇后（光明子）が藤原氏出身であり、仲麻呂が孝謙天皇の寵愛を受けていたためそれを背景に仲麻呂が急速に台頭していたからである。
sen.e: This confrontation was caused by the fact that being from the FUJIWARA clan herself, Empress Komyo (Komyoshi), the mother of Empress Koken, favored Nakamaro, which enabled him to gain power rapidly.
This confrontation was caused by the fact that being from the FUJIWARA clan herself, Empress Komyo (Komyoshi), the mother of Empress Koken, favored Nakamaro, which enabled him to gain power rapidly.
This confrontation was caused by the fact that being from the FUJIWARA clan herself, Empress Komyo (Komyoshi), the mother of Empress Koken, favored Nakamaro, which enabled him to gain power rapidly.

sen.j: 道祖王の廃太子にも光明皇后と仲麻呂が関与していたという説もある。
sen.e: There is also a theory that Empress Komyo and Nakamaro were involved in the deposition of Funado no Okimi.
There is also a theory that Empress Komyo and Nakamaro were involved in the deposition of Funado no Okimi.
There is also a theory that Empress Komyo and Nakamaro were involved in the deposition of Funado no Okimi.

sen.j: 天平勝宝9歳（757年）6月16日、大伴古麻呂が陸奥鎮守将軍となり、全成は陸奥鎮守副将軍兼任となる。
sen.e: On June 16, 757, OTOMO no Komaro bacame the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense for Mutsu Province, and Matanari took the position of the Vice-Shogun of the Defense for Mutsu.
On June 16, 757, OTOMO no Komaro bacame the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense for Mutsu Province, and Matanari took the position of the Vice-Shogun of the Defense for Mutsu.
On June 16, 757, OTOMO no Komaro bacame the Commander-in-Chief of the Defense for Mutsu Province, and Matanari took the position of the Vice-Shogun of the Defense for Mutsu.

sen.j: この人事は奈良麻呂派とみられていた古麻呂を中央から放逐したいと考えていた仲麻呂による事実上の左遷人事であった。
sen.e: These personnel appointments were virtually demotions planned by Nakamaro, who wanted to banish Komaro from the center, who was regarded as part of the group of Naramaro.
These personnel appointments were virtually demotions planned by Nakamaro, who wanted to banish Komaro from the center, who was regarded as part of the group of Naramaro.
These personnel appointments were virtually demotions planned by Nakamaro, who wanted to banish Komaro from the center, who was regarded as part of the group of Naramaro.

sen.j: 全成もまた仲麻呂派とみなされていたためずっと陸奥に閉じ込めておくための人事であったと考えられる。
sen.e: Matanari was also regarded as part of the group of Nakamaro, so thesepersonnel appointments were made in order to keep him inside Mutsu for good.
Matanari was also regarded as part of the group of Nakamaro, so these personnel appointments were made in order to keep him inside Mutsu for good.
sen.cmt: thesepersonnelの間にスペースを入れて修正しました。
sen.e: Matanari was also regarded as part of the group of Nakamaro, so these personnel appointments were made in order to keep him inside Mutsu for good.

sen.j: この時、奈良麻呂もまた兵部卿を解任され右大弁に左遷されている。
sen.e: Naramaro was also removed from the position of Hyobukyo (minister for millitary affairs) and demoted to be an Udaiben (major controller of the right).
Naramaro was also removed from the position of Hyobukyo (minister for millitary affairs) and demoted to be an Udaiben (major controller of the right).
Naramaro was also removed from the position of Hyobukyo (minister for millitary affairs) and demoted to be an Udaiben (major controller of the right).

sen.j: 6月中旬以降、奈良麻呂派は奈良麻呂邸などで反仲麻呂派の謀議をもつようになった。
sen.e: After mid-June, the group of Naramaro had meetings for conspiracy against Nakamaro at such places as the residence of Naramaro.
After mid-June, the group of Naramaro had meetings for conspiracy against Nakamaro at such places as the residence of Naramaro.
After mid-June, the group of Naramaro had meetings for conspiracy against Nakamaro at such places as the residence of Naramaro.

sen.j: 大伴古麻呂や小野東人は参加していたものの，全成が一連の謀議に参加していたかどうかは定かではない。
sen.e: OTOMO no Komaro and Ono no Azumahito attended these meetings, but it is not known whether Matanari did too.
OTOMO no Komaro and Ono no Azumahito attended these meetings, but it is not known whether Matanari did too.
OTOMO no Komaro and Ono no Azumahito attended these meetings, but it is not known whether Matanari did too.

sen.j: しかし、この謀議は6月28日、山背王が孝謙天皇に「奈良麻呂が兵をもって仲麻呂邸を囲む」旨を密告し露見することとなった。
sen.e: However, the conspiracy was disclosed on June 28, when Yamashiro no Okimi informed Empress Koken on that "Naramaro will surround the residence of Nakamaro with his troops."
However, the conspiracy was disclosed on June 28, when Yamashiro no Okimi informed Empress Koken on that "Naramaro will surround the residence of Nakamaro with his troops."
However, the conspiracy was disclosed on June 28, when Yamashiro no Okimi informed Empress Koken on that "Naramaro will surround the residence of Nakamaro with his troops."

sen.j: 7月2日、上道斐太都が小野東人から奈良麻呂らの謀反への参加を呼びかけられたと仲麻呂へ密告したことにより、仲麻呂は直ちに中衛府の兵を動かして前皇太子道祖王の邸を包囲し、小野東人らを捕らえて左衛士府の獄に下した（橘奈良麻呂の乱）。
sen.e: On July 2, in response to Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu's information that he was approached by Ono no Azumahito to be in part of the rebellion planned by Naramaro and others, Nakamaro instantly led the troops of Chuefu (guard) to surround the residence of Funado no Okimi, the former Crown Orince, and capture Ono no Azumahito and others to throw them into jail of Sa-Ejifu (the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro).

On July 2, in response to Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu's information that he was approached by Ono no Azumahito to be in part of the rebellion planned by Naramaro and others, Nakamaro instantly led the troops of Chuefu (guard) to surround the residence of Funado no Okimi, the former Crown Orince, and capture Ono no Azumahito and others to throw them into jail of Sa-Ejifu (the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro).

On July 2, in response to Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu's information that he was approached by Ono no Azumahito to be in part of the rebellion planned by Naramaro and others, Nakamaro instantly led the troops of Chuefu (guard) to surround the residence of Funado no Okimi, the former Crown Orince, and capture Ono no Azumahito and others to throw them into jail of Sa-Ejifu (the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro).

sen.j: 捕らえられた奈良麻呂派の者たちは次々と拷問にかけられた。
sen.e: Those in the group of Naramaro who were captured were tortured one after another.
Those in the group of Naramaro who were captured were tortured one after another.
Those in the group of Naramaro who were captured were tortured one after another.

sen.j: 全成もその一人で、7月4日、奈良麻呂の謀反を証言した後自害した。
sen.e: Matanari was one of them, and on July 4, he took his own life after testifying the rebellion of Naramaro.
Matanari was one of them, and on July 4, he took his own life after testifying the rebellion of Naramaro.
Matanari was one of them, and on July 4, he took his own life after testifying the rebellion of Naramaro.

sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂の乱では謀反に無関係であった反仲麻呂派の者も数多く捕らえられ、拷問の後に死亡したり官位を剥奪された上で流刑となった者も多いため全成もそういった人物の一人ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: In the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, many of those against Nakamaro who had nothing to do with the rebellion itself were also captured, and many of them died after being tortured or were deported after their official court ranks were deprived, so Matanari is considered as one of those people.

In the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, many of those against Nakamaro who had nothing to do with the rebellion itself were also captured, and many of them died after being tortured or were deported after their official court ranks were deprived, so Matanari is considered as one of those people.

In the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, many of those against Nakamaro who had nothing to do with the rebellion itself were also captured, and many of them died after being tortured or were deported after their official court ranks were deprived, so Matanari is considered as one of those people.
